programme.title: Basketball: NBA: Brooklyn Nets - New Orleans Pelicans
programme.desc: The National Basketball Association (in English: National Basketball Association, NBA), abbreviated NBA, is the world's most prestigious men's professional basketball league and among the 4 major professional sports leagues in North America.It was established on June 6, 1946 in New York under the name American Basketball Association (ABA).It received its new name in the fall of 1949 after the merger with the National Basketball League of the United States (NBL).The two most successful teams in the NBA are the Los Angeles Lakers and the Boston Celtics, who have won the title 17 times each.Other teams that became champions are: Golden State Warriors (7), Chicago Bulls (6), San Antonio Spurs (5), Philadelphia 76 (7), Detroit Pistons (3), Miami Heat (3), New York Knicks (2), Houston Rockets (2), Milwaukee Bucks (2), Cleveland Cavaliers (1), Washington Wizards (1), Atlanta Hawks (1), Oklahoma Thunder(1), Portland Trail Blazers (2), Baltimore Bullets (1), Dallas Mavericks (1), Toronto Raptors (1), Denver Nuggets (1) and Rochester Royals (1).

programme.desc: First Bundesliga is the highest level of German club football.It was established on August 24, 1963, it is a continuation of the German football championship, which existed since 1903. The founders of the Bundesliga in 1963 were Borussia Dortmund, Eintracht Braunschweig, Eintracht Frankfurt, Hamburger SV, Hertha Berlin, Kaiserslautern, Karlsruhe, Cologne, Maidenrich, 1860 Munich, Nuremberg, Preussen Münster,Saarbrücken, Schalke 04, Stuttgart and Werder.The first champion in 1964 was Cologne.The most successful team in the German First Bundesliga is undoubtedly Bayern Munich, which until 2023 has won 32 titles from 60 editions of the championship.

The founders of the Bundesliga in 1963 were Borussia Dortmund, Eintracht Braunschweig, Eintracht Frankfurt, Hamburger SV, Hertha Berlin, Kaiserslautern, Karlsruhe, Cologne, Maidenrich, 1860 Munich, Nuremberg, Preussen Münster,Saarbrücken, Schalke 04, Stuttgart and Werder.The first champion in 1964 was Cologne.The most successful team in the German First Bundesliga is undoubtedly Bayern Munich, which until 2023 has won 32 titles from 60 editions of the championship.

programme.title: Football: efbet League: Round 18: Dobruja - Ludogorets
programme.desc: The Bulgarian football championship has been played since 1924 with direct eliminations, and since 1948 in the form of a single league.Attempts to form a league in the first level of Bulgarian football were also made before 1948. In the period 1937-1940, a National Football Division (NFD) was established in Bulgaria with 10 teams, which played each against each other on an exchange visit in one season.The champion of the NFD was declared the champion of Bulgaria.It is important to note that "A" RFG, the Premier League, "A" PFG and the current First League are accepted by football history and statistics as the first level in the championship of Bulgaria from 1948 to the present day, the division in which our strongest clubs compete.At the same time, the NFD was an integral part of the State Championship before 1944 and its three editions were not included in the assets of the "A" group.

programme.title: Football: FA Cup: Round 2: Salford City v Leyton Orient
programme.desc: The Football Association Challenge Cup, better known as the FA Cup, is an elimination tournament in English football.The name "FA Cup" refers to the English men's football tournament.The equivalent competition for women is called the FA Women's Cup.The FA Cup is the oldest football competition in the world.The beginning was made on July 20, 1871 in London, and the purpose of the competition is to have all the clubs - members of the federation - participate in it.15 teams took part in the first competition.The FA Cup competition involves all teams up to the ninth tier of English football, as well as some from the 10th tier.A record 763 clubs participated in the 2011-12 season.Over the years, the participation of teams from the lower divisions has led to sensational victories over the big clubs, although clubs from the lower divisions rarely reach the final of the tournament.

programme.title: Football: Ligue 1 France: Round 15: Toulouse - Strasbourg
programme.desc: League 1 consists of 20 teams competing against each other in 38 rounds, on an alternating away basis.The French Championship dates back to 1892, the so-called Amateur League until 1929. In 1932, the foundations of professionally organized football in France were laid.The French Division 1 included in its first season, 1932-33, the following teams, divided into two groups: Club Française, Excelsior, Hierre, Lille, Marseille, Mulhouse, Nice, Nîmes, Racing Paris, Sette, Ale, Antibes, Cannes, SA Paris, Fives, Metz, Montpellier, Red Star, Rennes and Sochaux.In recent years, the club Paris Saint-Germain, formed much later, has been an absolute dominator on the domestic scene, but before that Lyon, Marseille, Bordeaux, Monaco, Nantes, Saint-Etienne, Reims, Nice, Lance, etc. also had a lot of success.

programme.title: Basketball: Euroleague: Round 14: Apoel Tel Aviv - ASVEL
programme.desc: The EuroLeague is the leading club basketball competition at the European level and is supported by Turkish Airlines.Each year, 18 teams are included in the tournament, which go through a regular season in a "everyone against everyone" format with an exchange of hosts.Twelve of them have guaranteed participation - these are Anadolu Efes, ASVEL, Bayern Munich, Barcelona, ​​Fenerbahce, Maccabi, Olympia Milano, Olympiakos, Panathinaikos, Real Madrid and Zalgiris.The remaining six positions are filled by clubs that meet certain criteria set by FIBA.After the regular season ends, the playoffs follow, with the top eight teams facing each other in best-of-three, five-game series.The winners qualify for the "Final Four", where the semi-finals and final are played on neutral ground to determine the champion of Europe.

programme.title: Motoring: Nascar Cup Series: Round 36: Alabama Race
programme.desc: NASCAR (in English: National Association for Stock Car Auto Racing, NASCAR) is a motor sports series that takes place in the United States.In the early 20th century, when alcohol was banned in the US, bootleggers modified their cars to outrun the police.To this end, races have been held on the beaches of Daytona.After a while, these competitions aroused the interest of the people, and so the competitions became public.The sport began to develop after the Second World War, when different competitions with different rules were organized.The first NASCAR race was held in 1947 by Daytona president, Bill France Sr., two months later on February 15, 1948, the first official NASCAR race was held at the same track and the winner was Red Byron with a Ford.But a championship was not held because most teams had economic problems caused by the lack of gasoline.

programme.title: Football: Italian Serie A: Round 13: Milan - Lazio
programme.desc: Serie A is the highest football division in Italy.In the period 1898 – 1929, the Italian championship, then held on a regional basis, was called the National Football Championship (Campionato Nazionale di Football).It assumed its current name in 1929 when it switched to a "national divisions" format.Co-founders of Serie A are: Alessandria, Ambrosiana, Bologna, Brescia, Cremonese, Genoa, Juventus, Lazio, Livorno, Milan, Modena, Napoli, Padova, Pro Patria, Pro Vercelli, Roma, Torino and Triestina.The first championship in Serie A is Ambrosiana.Three of the leading teams not only at the national, but also at the European and World level are Juventus, Milan and Inter, but there are also teams with great success such as Lazio, Roma, Napoli, Genoa, Torino, Bologna, Fiorentina, Atalanta, Cagliari, Verona, Sampdoria and Parma.

programme.title: Football: Italian Serie A: Round 13: Atalanta - Fiorentina
programme.desc: Serie A is the highest football division in Italy.In the period 1898 – 1929, the Italian championship, then held on a regional basis, was called the National Football Championship (Campionato Nazionale di Football).It assumed its current name in 1929 when it switched to a "national divisions" format.Co-founders of Serie A are: Alessandria, Ambrosiana, Bologna, Brescia, Cremonese, Genoa, Juventus, Lazio, Livorno, Milan, Modena, Napoli, Padova, Pro Patria, Pro Vercelli, Roma, Torino and Triestina.The first championship in Serie A is Ambrosiana.Three of the leading teams not only at the national, but also at the European and World level are Juventus, Milan and Inter, but there are also teams with great success such as Lazio, Roma, Napoli, Genoa, Torino, Bologna, Fiorentina, Atalanta, Cagliari, Verona, Sampdoria and Parma.

programme.title: Football: UEFA Europa League: Round 5: Roma - Midtjylland
programme.desc: The UEFA Europa League is an international club football tournament in which teams from different European countries participate.Its development builds on the traditions of previous competitions such as the Fair Cities Cup, the Cup Winners' Cup and the UEFA Cup.Today, the tournament is defined as the second most prestigious in European club football after the Champions League.Since its inception under the name Europa League, the most successful team has been the Spanish Sevilla, who have won the award a record 7 times.The contestants are inheritors of the form and achievements of the old UEFA Cup tournament.

programme.title: Football: UEFA Champions League: Round 5: Ajax - Benfica
programme.desc: The UEFA Champions League is the most prestigious club tournament in Europe, where the leading teams from different national leagues meet.Founded in 1955 as the "European Champions Cup", it changed its name to its current one in the 1992/93 season.It is organized annually by UEFA and is considered the pinnacle of club football.To date, 23 teams have won the title, with 12 of them winning it more than once.Real Madrid holds the record with 15 trophies, including five in a row.Since Milan's last title in 1990, no team has been able to defend the trophy twice in a row, underscoring the incredible competition and high level of the tournament.

programme.title: Football: Copa del Rey: Extremadura - Sevilla
programme.desc: The Copa del Rey is an annual football tournament in Spain.It is held in honor of the King of Spain and its full name in Spanish is: Copa de Su Majestad El Rey.The competition features teams from La Liga up to the sixth tier of Spanish football playing against each other in a single match.Only the semi-finals in the tournament are played in two games, with the host changed.The first edition dates back to 1902, after Carlos Padros, then president of Bilbao FC and later of Madrid FC, proposed a football tournament in honor of the coronation of Alfonso XIII.It was then won by Bilbao FC, however, it was not recognized as official by the Royal Spanish Football Federation.In 1903, the first official edition of the King's Cup was held, which was won by Real Madrid.The most successful club in the tournament is Barcelona.

programme.title: Soccer: Spanish La Liga: Round 14: Rayo Vallecano v Valencia
programme.desc: The Primera División, also known as La Liga, is the top-level division in Spain's professional football league hierarchy.The highest level of football in Spain began its history in 1929. The founders of the league in 1929 were Barcelona, ​​Real Madrid, Athletic Bilbao, Real Sociedad, Arenas, Atlético Madrid, Espanyol, Europa, Real Union, Racing Santander.Since the 1950s, Real Madrid and Barcelona have dominated this championship.The other teams that have won the championship are Atlético Madrid, Athletic Bilbao, Valencia, Real Sociedad, Real Betis, Deportivo La Coruña and Sevilla.La Liga is considered one of the strongest leagues in Europe along with the Italian Serie A and the English Premier League.
